intro: Onosma khorassanica, commonly known as Persian thyme, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its aromatic, hairy leaves and clusters of small blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It is valued for its medicinal properties and is often used in traditional herbal remedies. Its compact growth habit makes it suitable for rock gardens and as a ornamental plant.
